page.title: 01ALLINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: Allington is in the middle of the countryside, it is a small village of about 600 people. It is about 5 miles from Grantham, a town in Lincolnshire. It has got a village hall, a shop, a school. a pub, a church and two graveyards. The village lies on higher ground surrounded by fairly flat farm land, which is mostly for crops and grazing. There are two playing fields and a village green. The old part of the school was built in 1906 and in 1983 a new building was added. There is an old Elizabethan Manor House. An ancient Salt Well lies to the South of the village. Holy Trinity Church is the one remaining of two churches. The old Market Cross stands still on the Village Green. This is a very active village with annual Gala, Fete, Pantomine, Village Quiz, and Plays. Clubs include Cricket, Football,
